content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 473.9 - Application for consignment permits

State Regulations
(a) Eligible carriers who need emergency
permits in a volume amounting to 200 permits or more per year may apply for
consignment permits. Consignment permits may only be used for vehicles owned by
the carrier or under long-term lease where the carrier has complete control
over the leased vehicle. Consignment permits may be requested in units of not
less than 20 permits nor more than 200 permits. The permit fees must be paid in
full with the filing of the application, and permit fees paid are not
refundable except in the case where a replacement series has been required and
in such event unused permits may be converted to the current series permits. The number of permits requested and the number to be issued at any one time may
not exceed 10 percent of the vehicles then registered to the applicant under
article 21 of the Tax Law. Successive applications will not be accepted until
75 percent of the previous order of consignment permits have been registered
with the department to a particular vehicle. (b) Permits issued by the department to
applicants on a request for consignment permits may not be used by the
applicant for trucks or trailers which transport automotive fuel, nor may they
be used for omnibuses nor may they be used as a replacement for a lost or
stolen sticker. Consignment permits may be used only by the carrier to whom
they were issued and may not be transferred. (c) A carrier is not eligible to apply for
consignment permits unless the carrier has filed timely returns for the return
periods in the 12 months preceding the date of application and paid with such
returns all taxes due and provides the evidence of financial responsibility
requested. Permission to use or to continue to use consignment permits may be
withdrawn at any time if the carrier fails to file a highway use permit report
when a motor vehicle (other than an omnibus, or a truck or trailer required to
display an "AFC" sticker) of the carrier is employed on a public highway of
this State with a consignment sticker, if such a permit report is not timely
filed or if the truck mileage or fuel use tax returns of the taxpayer are not
timely filed or the tax is not timely paid. (d) Immediately after a consignment permit
and sticker is assigned to a motor vehicle, the carrier must complete form
TMT-1.11, Consignment Highway Use Permit Report, and forward such form to the

Tax Department. (e) Any change
relating to the information contained in the application must be reported
immediately to the Tax Department. Thus, any change in the carrier's business
or other address, or in the name of ownership of its business must be so
reported. (f) In addition, if a
motor vehicle for which a permit has been issued is transferred or junked or if
the business of a permit holder is sold or if the lease of a motor vehicle for
which a permit has been issued has expired, the Tax Department must be notified
within five days. In such cases the sticker must be destroyed and the permit
must be returned to the department for cancellation. Notes
